entry.title: The Welfare Reform (2007 Act) (Commencement No. 1) Order (Northern Ireland) 2007
entry.summary: This Order provides for the coming into operation of section 52 of, and Schedule 6 to, the Welfare Reform Act (Northern Ireland) 2007 (provision relating to “relevant employer” for the purposes of the Pneumoconiosis, etc., (Workers’ Compensation) (Northern Ireland) Order 1979 (S.I. 1979/925 (N.I. 9))) on 19th July 2007 for the purpose only of authorising the making of an order and 10th August 2007 for all other purposes.

entry.title: The Trade Marks (Fees) (Amendment) Rules 2007
entry.summary: These Rules amend the Trade Marks (Fees) Rules 2000 (S.I. 2000/137) to require the payment of £50 if the proprietor of a Community trade mark or international trade mark (EC) wishes to receive notification of the results of a search of the register conducted under Article 4 of the Trade Marks (Relative Grounds) Order 2007 (S.I. 2007/1976).

entry.title: The Companies (Political Expenditure Exemption) Order 2007
entry.summary: This Order exempts certain political expenditure incurred by news companies from the need for authorisation by the company’s members under Part 14 of the Companies Act 2006.

entry.title: The Limited Liability Partnerships (Amendment) Regulations 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations amend Schedules 2 and 6 to the Limited Liability Partnerships Regulations 2001 (S.I. 2001/1090) (“the principal regulations”). The principal regulations apply certain provisions of the Companies Act 1985 (c.6) (“the 1985 Act”), and certain subordinate legislation made under that Act, to limited liability partnerships (“LLPs”).

entry.title: The Gambling Act 2005 (Gaming Machines) (Definitions) Regulations 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations assign meanings to the terms “dual-use computer” and “domestic computer” for the purposes of section 235(2)(a) of the Gambling Act 2005 (‘the Act’).

entry.title: The Trade Marks (Amendment) Rules 2007
entry.summary: These Rules amend the Trade Mark Rules 2000 (SI 2000/136 as amended) (“the 2000 Rules”).

entry.title: The Transmissible Spongiform Encephalopathies (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Transmissible Spongiform Encephalopathies Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2006 (S.R. 2006 No.202), which provide for the enforcement in relation to Northern Ireland of Regulation (EC) No. 999/2001 of the European Parliament and of the Council laying down rules for the prevention, control and eradication of certain transmissible spongiform encephalopathies (OJ No. L147, 31.5.2001, p.1) as amended by and as read with the Community instruments set out in Schedule1 to S.R. 2006 No.202.

entry.title: Students Awards (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations further amend the Students Awards Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003 (S.R. 2003 No. 459) “the principal Regulations”. The principal Regulations ensure that students who began their courses before 1st September 1998, and certain other students, continue to receive students awards and payments under those awards until the end of their courses.

entry.title: The Industrial Training Levy (Construction Industry) Order (Northern Ireland) 2007
entry.summary: This Order gives effect to proposals submitted by the Construction Industry Training Board to the Department for Employment and Learning for the imposition of a further levy upon employers in the construction industry for the purpose of raising money towards the expenses of the Board.

entry.title: The Nutrition and Health Claims (England) Regulations 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations, which apply in relation to England only, make provision for the execution and enforcement of Regulation (EC) No 1924/2006 of the European Parliament and of the Council on nutrition and health claims made on foods, as corrected by a Corrigendum (OJ No. L12, 18.1.2007, p3), “the EC Regulation”.

entry.title: The Police and Justice Act 2006 (Commencement No.1) (Northern Ireland) Order 2007
entry.summary: This Order brings into force in Northern Ireland section 13 of the Police and Justice Act 2006 on 30th July 2007.

entry.title: The Education (Individual Pupil Information) (Prescribed Persons) (Amendment) Regulations 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Education (Individual Pupil Information) (Prescribed Persons) Regulations 1999 so as to include as prescribed persons those listed in regulation 4(1) and to include as categories of prescribed persons those listed in regulation 4(2). These prescriptions are for the purposes of providing and receiving information on individual pupils.

title.div: The Welsh Forms of Oaths and Affirmations (Government of Wales Act 2006) Order 2007 / Gorchymyn Ffurfiau Cymraeg Llwon a Chadarnhadau (Deddf Llywodraeth Cymru 2006) 2007

div.p: This Order prescribes Welsh forms of oaths and affirmations which certain members of the Welsh Assembly Government, and members of the National Assembly for Wales, are required by the Government of Wales Act 2006 (c. 32) (“GOWA 2006”) to take. GOWA 2006 provides that the English forms of those oaths and affirmations are to be ones which are contained in the Promissory Oaths Act 1868 (c. 72) and the Oaths Act 1978 (c. 19)

Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn rhagnodi ffurfiau Cymraeg llwon a chadarnhadau y mae'n ofynnol i aelodau penodol o Lywodraeth Cynulliad Cymru, ac aelodau o Gynulliad Cenedlaethol Cymru, eu cymryd gan Ddeddf Llywodraeth Cymru (p.32) (“DLlC 2006”). Mae DLlC yn darparu mai'r rheini a geir yn Neddf Llwon Addewidiol 1868 (p.72) ac yn Neddf Llwon 1978 (p.19) yw ffurfiau Saesneg y llwon a'r cadarnhadau hynny i fod.

entry.title: The Traffic Management Act 2004 (Commencement No. 5 and Transitional Provisions) (England) Order 2007
entry.summary: This Order commences, as respects England, provisions of Part 6 (civil enforcement of traffic contraventions) of the Traffic Management Act 2004 which relate to the enforcement of parking contraventions.

entry.title: The Justice and Security (Northern Ireland) Act 2007 (Commencement No.1 and Transitional Provisions) Order 2007
entry.summary: This Order brings into force on 19th July 2007 section 8(4) of the Justice and Security (Northern Ireland) Act 2007, and on 1st August 2007 the provisions of that Act which are listed in article2(3). Article3 provides that licences in respect of the provision of security services issued under paragraph 7 of Schedule 13 to the Terrorism Act 2000, but which have not expired when that provision ceases to have effect at the end of 31st July 2007, will have effect as if issued under paragraph 9 of Schedule 6 to the Justice and Security (Northern Ireland) Act 2007. It also provides that applications for a licence may be made under paragraph 8(1) of that Schedule 6 in advance of that provision coming into force on 1stAugust 2007.

entry.title: The Zoonoses and Animal By-Products (Fees) (England) Regulations 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations, which apply in England, revoke the Poultry Breeding Flocks, Hatcheries and Animal By-Products (Fees) (England) Order 2002.

title.div: The Transmissible Spongiform Encephalopathies (Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2007 / Rheoliadau Enseffalopathïau Sbyngffurf Trosglwyddadwy (Cymru) (Diwygio) 2007

div.p: These Regulations amend the Transmissible Spongiform Encephalopathies (Wales) Regulations 2006 (S.I. 2006/1226), which provide for the enforcement in relation to Wales of Regulation (EC) No. 999/2001 of the European Parliament and of the Council laying down rules for the prevention, control and eradication of certain transmissible spongiform encephalopathies (OJ No. L147, 31.5.2001, p.1) as amended by and as read with the Community instruments set out in Schedule 1 to S.I. 2006/1226.

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn diwygio Rheoliadau Enseffalopathïau Sbyngffurf Trosglwyddadwy (Cymru) 2006 (O.S. 2006/1226), sy'n darparu ar gyfer gorfodi, o ran Cymru, Reoliad (EC) Rhif 999/2001 Senedd Ewrop a'r Cyngor sy'n gosod rheolau ar gyfer atal, rheoli a chael gwared ar enseffalopathïau sbyngffurf trosglwyddadwy penodol (OJ Rhif L147, 31.5.2001, t.1) fel y'i diwygir gan yr offerynnau Cymunedol a geir yn Atodlen 1 i O.S. 2006/1226 ac fel y'i darllenir gyda hwy.

entry.title: The Football Spectators (Seating) Order 2007

ukm:Subject.Value: SPORTS GROUNDS AND SPORTING EVENTS, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: SPORTS GROUNDS AND SPORTING EVENTS, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: This Order directs the Football Licensing Authority to include in any licence to admit spectators to the football grounds specified in Schedule 1, a condition imposing the requirements specified in Schedule 2. In order to admit spectators to a designated football match a licence is required under the Football Spectators Act 1989. “Designated football matches” are those matches designated by the Secretary of State under section 1(2) of the Football Spectators Act 1989 and they include all association football matches played at the premises specified in Schedule 1 to this Order.

entry.title: The National Minimum Wage Act 1998 (Amendment) Regulations 2007

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The National Minimum Wage Act 1998 (Amendment) Regulations 2007

entry.summary: These Regulations amend section 3 of the National Minimum Wage Act 1998.

entry.title: The Protection of Children and Vulnerable Adults (2003 Order) (Commencement No. 3) Order (Northern Ireland) 2007
entry.summary: This Order appoints 30th July 2007 for the coming into operation of Article 46, the last remaining provision of the Protection of Children and Vulnerable Adults (Northern Ireland) Order 2003, “the 2003 Order”.
